chav1961.purelib.i18n.interfaces

Interface Localizer

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, SpiService<Localizer>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractLocalizer, DebuggingLocalizer, FileSystemLocalizer, PropertiesLocalizer, PureLibLocalizer

    public interface Localizer
extends AutoCloseable, SpiService<Localizer>

    This interface describes a wrapper for the standard Java internationalization mechanism. It supports a set of features:

    • list of supported locales with it's descriptors, language and icons
    • locale listeners mechanism to call on locale changing
    • substitutions in the locale values content (including URLs)
    • automatic Creole markup language processing for value content
    • dynamic hierarchy of the localizers

    All Localizers in the system can be used by two ways:

    • stand-alone localizer
    • multi-root tree of the localizers

    Any stand-alone localizers can be organized to a multi-root tree to get a special behavior for them. To build a multi-root tree, the following methods can be used:

    • add(Localizer) - to add sibling localizer for the given tree node or stand-alone localizer
    • remove(Localizer) - to remove sibling localizer from the given tree node
    • push(Localizer) - to create a child for the given tree node or stand-alone localizer, and place a localizer to it
    • close() - to remove a child was created earlier by push(Localizer) from the tree. This method allows Localizer to use it in the try-with-resource statements
    • pop() - to remove all children for the given tree node
    • setParent(Localizer) - to link/unlink parent for the given Localizer

    All the localizers at the given tree node have united resource keys, so resource keys must have unique names. Any child localizer can have the same name of the resource keys and this names blind the same ones in their parents. Attempt to get resource value by it's name sequentially resolves from the current level of the tree to it's root. Attempt to change locale for the given Localizer expands to all of it's siblings and children in the tree node. Methods walkDown(LocaleWalking) and walkUp(LocaleWalking) need be used to implement this functionality.

    Any content of the values returned can contain a substitution (see CharUtils.substitute(String, String, SubstitutionSource) method and SubstitutableProperties class for details). Any of the also can contain an URL reference to include it's content into the value string. Syntax of url reference is:

    ... url(<any_valid_url>)

    URL reference can be absolute (including scheme) and relative. Relative URL is always a resource reference inside the project (see Class.getResource(String) method).

    Since:
    0.0.2
    Author:
    Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
    See Also:
    CreoleWriter, SubstitutableProperties

      • supportedLocales

        Iterable<Localizer.LocaleDescriptor> supportedLocales()

        Get list of the supported locales.

        Returns:
        list of supported locales. Can't be null. It's content is joined from all added/pushed localizers
        See Also:
        add(Localizer), remove(Localizer), push(Localizer)

      • containsKey

        boolean containsKey(String key)
             throws IllegalArgumentException

        Checks the key was defined anywhere in the localizers.

        Parameters:
        key - key to check existance. Key content is case-sensitive
        Returns:
        true if the key is defined anywhere. Result is ORed from all all added/pushed localizers
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if key to test is null or empty

      • availableKeys

        Iterable<String> availableKeys()

        Get list of all available keys defined anywhere

        Returns:
        list of the defined keys. Can't be null. It's content is joined from all added/pushed localizers.
        See Also:
        getValue(String)

      • localKeys

        Iterable<String> localKeys()

        Get list available keys in the current Localizer only

        Returns:
        list of the defined keys. Can't be null. It's content is joined from all added/pushed localizers.
        See Also:
        getLocalValue(String)

      • getValue

        String getValue(String key)
         throws LocalizationException,
                IllegalArgumentException

        Get localization value for the given key. Extracts and substitute values (see SubstitutableProperties) from localization content. Also processed a set of URLs inside the localization string. Each url inside the localization string has syntax:

        url(<valid_url>[,<valid_MIME>])

        Relative URL (with the missing scheme) points to resource inside the JRE class tree. Duplicated keys in the localizer hierarchy always are resolved to the deepest localizer content

        Parameters:
        key - key to get localization string for. Key content is case-sensitive
        Returns:
        string localized
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere.
        IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty

      • getLocalValue

        String getLocalValue(String key)
              throws LocalizationException,
                     IllegalArgumentException

        Get localization value for the given key in the current Localizer only.

        Parameters:
        key - key to get localization string for. Key content is case-sensitive
        Returns:
        string localized
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere.
        IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty
        See Also:
        getValue(String)

      • getContent

        Reader getContent(String key)
           throws LocalizationException,
                  IllegalArgumentException

        Get localization value for the given key as Reader.

        Parameters:
        key - key to get localization content for
        Returns:
        localized content
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere.
        IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty
        See Also:
        getValue(String)

      • getContent

        Reader getContent(String key,
                  MimeType sourceType,
                  MimeType targetType)
           throws LocalizationException,
                  IllegalArgumentException,
                  NullPointerException

        Get and convert localization value for the given key as Reader. Valid MIME types to source MIME are:

        • text/plain [charset=...]
        • text/x-wikicreole [charset=...]

        Valid MIME types to target MIME are:

        • text/plain
        • text/html
        Parameters:
        key - key to get localization content for
        sourceType - MIME type for the source content (for example 'text/x-wikicreole charset=UTF-8;')
        targetType - MIME type for the target content (for example 'text/html')
        Returns:
        localized content
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - if the key is missing anywhere or conversion errors at the runtime
        IllegalArgumentException - if key to get is null or empty, also unsupported or unknown conversion combination
        NullPointerException - if source or target type is null

      • getLocalizerId

        String getLocalizerId()

        Get unique identifier of the localizer

        Returns:
        unique identifier of the localized. Can't be null or empty. It's strongly recommended to use localizer URI as value returned

        IllegalArgumentException - string is empty

      • add

        Localizer add(Localizer newLocalizer)
       throws LocalizationException,
              NullPointerException,
              IllegalArgumentException

        Add new localizer to the current level of the hierarchy. Adding the localizer doesn't change it's own parent, siblings and children. Parent for the localizer to add will be set to this parent.

        Parameters:
        newLocalizer - localizer to add.
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - localizer to add has duplicated keys at the given hierarchy level
        NullPointerException - localizer to add is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the localized already was added

      • remove

        Localizer remove(Localizer localizer)
          throws LocalizationException,
                 NullPointerException,
                 IllegalArgumentException,
                 IllegalStateException

        Remove the localizer from any level of the hierarchy. Removing the localizer doesn't remove it's children from it. Parent of the localizer to remove will be cleared

        Parameters:
        localizer - localizer to remove
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - when any localization problems were detected
        NullPointerException - localizer to remove is null
        IllegalArgumentException - attempt to remove self
        IllegalStateException - localizer was removed earlier or was not added

      • push

        Localizer push(Localizer newLocalizer)
        throws LocalizationException,
               NullPointerException,
               IllegalArgumentException

        Create new level or the hierarchy and push first localizer here. Localizer added can be removed by remove(Localizer) or by pop() method. If child level of the hierarchy already exists, simply adds new localizer in it. Parent for the localizer to push will be set to this localizer. Duplicated keys in the localizer blind the same keys in the hierarchy tail

        Parameters:
        newLocalizer - localizer to push.
        Returns:
        clone of the localizer. Calling close() on this instance should automatically calls the pop() method on the 'parent' localizer
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - when any localization problems were detected
        NullPointerException - localizer to add is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if the localized already was added

      • pop

        Localizer pop()
       throws LocalizationException

        Remove all localizers from the current hierarchy level and pop it

        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - when any localization problems were detected

      • getParent

        Localizer getParent()

        Get parent localizer for this localizer.

        Returns:
        parent localizer. Can be null

      • setParent

        Localizer setParent(Localizer parent)
             throws LocalizationException

        St parent localizer for the given localizer

        Parameters:
        parent - parent localizer to set. Can be null
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - on recursive dependencies

      • addLocaleChangeListener

        Localizer addLocaleChangeListener(Localizer.LocaleChangeListener listener)

        Add listener to notify about locale changes. Listener about to remove should clear it's notification lists automatically

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        self

      • walkUp

        ContinueMode walkUp(Localizer.LocaleWalking processor)
             throws NullPointerException,
                    LocalizationException

        Walk Localizers tree from the current to the root. Every sibling (but not it's children) on every level need be processed.

        Parameters:
        processor - processor to process every node in the tree
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - processor is null
        LocalizationException - any errors when processing

      • walkDown

        ContinueMode walkDown(Localizer.LocaleWalking processor)
               throws NullPointerException,
                      LocalizationException

        Walk Localizers tree from the current to all the children. Every sibling on every level need be processed.

        Parameters:
        processor - processor to process every node in the tree
        Returns:
        self
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - processor is null
        LocalizationException - any errors when processing

      • close

        void close()
    throws LocalizationException

        Close the localizer. Localizer to close purges it's notification list, removes self from parent localizers and calls pop() method on the 'parent' localizer

        Specified by:
        close in interface AutoCloseable
        Throws:
        LocalizationException - any errors when processing
